titleStmt.title: Book of Joshua, Book of Judges, Book of Ruth, 4 Books of Kings

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

msItem.filiation: copied from a manuscript that was brought from the Ethiopian Monastery in Jerusalem to Rome and is now kept at the Library of the Biblical Society in London - that served as basis for Dillmann's edition and is described in 4-5 164

copied from a manuscript that belonged previously to the Ethiopian Monastery in Jerusalem

msItem.rubric: the chapter divisions are marked, corresponding more or less at those of the Vulgate

<locus target="ms_i1" <locus target="ms_i2" <locus target="ms_i3" several ecclesiastical lessons (readings?) both marginal and in the body of the text as described in 164

item.locus: at the end of the Book of Ruth

desc.q: ጸልዩ ፡ ለእለ ፡ ጸመውነ ፡ ለዛቲ ፡ መጽሐፍ ፡ ወለይስሓቅ ፡ ገብርክሙ ፡ ዘወሀበ ፡ ዛቲ ፡ ለኢየሩሳሌም ፡ ቅድስት ።
pray for us who lived in reclusion for this book and for Yǝsḥāq your servant, who donated it to Holy Jerusalem

history.provenance: together with BNFet1 belonged to Picques who left it to the library of the Jacobins Saint-Honoré; it came to the Bibliothèque nationale during the French Revolution
